Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
evaluation
<programming> 1. Converting an expression into a value using some {reduction strategy}.
2. The process of examining a system or system component to determine the extent to which specified properties are present.
(1996-05-13)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Evaluation \E*val`u*a"tion\, n. [Cf. F. ['e]valuation, LL. evaluatio.] Valuation; appraisement. --J. S. Mill. [1913 Webster]
evaluation n 1: act of ascertaining or fixing the value or worth of [syn: {rating}] 2: an appraisal of the value of something; "he set a high valuation on friendship" [syn: {valuation}, {rating}]
